org.epochx.epox
Class Variable

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.epox.Node
      org.epochx.epox.Variable
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Variable
extends Node

Variables are nodes with a changeable value. The difference between a Literal node and a Variable node is subtle. Variable instances cannot be copied, instead, all references to the same variable should refer to the same Variable instance. In contrast, Literal instances may be cloned and behave like most other node types.

See Also:
Literal

Constructor Detail

Variable

public Variable(java.lang.String identifier,
                java.lang.Class<?> datatype)
Constructs a new variable with a null value. The variable's name and data-type must be provided. The given identifier and data-type must be non-null.

Parameters:
identifier - the name of the variable.
datatype - the data-type that all values will be assignable to.

Variable

public Variable(java.lang.String identifier,
                java.lang.Object value)
Constructs a new variable with the given value. The variable's name is provided but the data-type is determined by the type of the given value. The given identifier and value must be non-null. If the value is unknown then use the alternative constructor and provide the data-type. If the value really should be null, then use the other constructor, and then call the setValue(Object) method which will allow the null value once the data-type has been set.

Parameters:
identifier - the name of the variable.
value - the starting value of the variable.
Method Detail

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
Sets the value of the variable. The data-type of a Variable cannot be changed after construction, and only values which are instances of subclasses of the original data-type may be used. A null value is considered valid for a variable of any data-type.

Parameters:
value - the value to set for the variable.

getReturnType

public java.lang.Class<?> getReturnType(java.lang.Class<?>... inputTypes)
Returns the data-type of this variable, as set upon construction. This variable is guaranteed to evaluate to a value of this given data-type.

Overrides:

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Compares this variable to the given object for equality. Two variables are only considered to be equal if they refer to the same variable instance.

Overrides:
equals in class Node
Parameters:
obj -
Returns:
true if the given object refers to the same instance as this object, and false otherwise.

clone

public Variable clone()
Variable objects cannot be cloned. Calls to this method will return a reference to this same instance. That is: 
 x.clone() == x
 
 
 
 will be true.





Overrides:
clone in class Node







Returns:
a reference to this variable instance.

newInstance

public Variable newInstance()
It is not possible to construct a new instance from this variable. Calling this method will return a reference to this same instance.

Overrides:
newInstance in class Node
Returns:
a reference to this variable instance.
